fields.summary: Race Condition When Stopping DelegationTokenRenewer causes RM crash during failover

comments.body:
{quote}pool size = 0, active threads = 0, queued tasks = 0{quote}

Pool size is 0 because the pool was shut down is my guess.
Also tighten things up a little (make start and stop symmetrical) when it comes to blocking.

This message was automatically generated.
Unit test failures appear to be unrelated.

[~belugabehr] Thank you for logging this issue.
When I look at the change I do not understand why we would need the first part of the change. The {{pendingEventQueue}} is only used inside the {{processDelegationTokenRenewerEvent}} inside the lock. After we change the state of the service we stop writing into the queue and directly go and process them.
The second part of the change looks good to me.

Can you please write a junit test for this?

[~wilfreds] Can you please provide thoughts on how to unit test a race condition of this sort?  How to introduce pauses into the locked code?

Also, there technically isn't a need to lock on the initialization.  It's just a safety and good practice item.  There will be almost no overheard since we will only initialize one time (or maybe a couple) of times, so it doesn't hurt to be safe.

I don't think this is a really a race condition that you need to test. Currently when we stop the service we do not set the flag {{isServiceStarted}}. So in a unit test I would just call the {{serviceStop}} and then call the {{applicationFinished}} from the same thread. Since the flag is not set I would expect that to fail without the fix and pass with the fix.

My environment is unable to build for some reason and I was spending a lot of time trying to figure it out.  Therefore, I was unable to run the associated unit test, but I did include it here.  Fingers are crossed.  Thanks for proposing this test.

You could use the createNewDelegationTokenRenewer method in TestDelegationTokenRenewer, or you could use that as a model for how to initialize the RMContext. Please also address the minor checkstyle issues in the test.

This message was automatically generated.
[~billie.rinaldi] Thank you for the assist!  I have been on vacation now for a little bit and have been unable to work on this.

Thank you [~belugabehr] patch is looking better now.

I still do not see why the first part of the change is needed: there is no need for locking around the cleanup of the {{pendingEventQueue}}. We do not have it currently and there is nothing that could throw. Setting the {{isServiceStarted}} on shutdown should be within the lock but it can not throw, neither can the shutdown, so I don't see why we would use the try..finally in the change at that point either. It does not provide anything extra.

I have attached a new patch with the suggestions from [~wilfreds] but I personally like the locking symmetric as I think it is a common usage pattern and is less error prone moving forward into the future.  It is more in line with what other coders would expect... instead of them having to wonder why we lock in only some places instead of other.

| (/) *{color:green}+1 overall{color}* |

[~wilfreds] {{try...finally}} is a best practice.

bq. It is recommended practice to always immediately follow a call to lock with a try block, most typically in a before/after construction

https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/locks/ReentrantLock.html

Please consider patch version 3 for inclusion into the project.
[~wilfreds], any further comments about patch 3, given that try/finally is the recommended best practice?
[~billie.rinaldi] [~wilfreds] Any additional concerns?  Please commit.

Sorry for the delay was caught up in other things:
Try/Finally might be recommended but I really do not see why we would do it in this case: we only need to set a boolean to true or false within the lock. Anything else would change the flow completely. We should not process the events or shut down the service within the lock. We really only want to set the boolean within the lock and don't do anything else.

The attached patch looks good, +1. Thanks [~belugabehr]. 

I did some minor rebase to apply it on top of trunk. 

[~wilfreds], for your last comment, I'm not sure if I fully understand.

I think we want to make sure the event processing
{{renewerService.execute(new DelegationTokenRenewerRunnable(evt));}}
Will not be rejected by a shutdown call.

If we remove the shutdown out of lock, it is possible that thread B shutdown the executor while A is inside {{execute}}. 

Please let me know if I misunderstood this.

If everybody agrees, I will commit the patch by tomorrow.

Ah, I see what Wilfred is saying now. I don't think the locking is done correctly in patch 6. I think Wangda is right that isServiceStarted = false and renewerService.shutdown() both need to be performed while the lock is held in serviceStop, and Wilfred is right that the locking in serviceStart should not be changed. ThreadPoolExecutor.shutdown says that previously submitted tasks are executed, but it still seems like it would be safer to include the shutdown in the lock. I'll attach patch 7 with my proposed changes.
Patch 7 is the same as patch 3 without the serviceStart changes.
